intro: Alopecuropsis japonica, commonly known as Japanese hairless plant, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its unique, hairless leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or rocky areas. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in humid, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
